did.unittitle: Zion Lutheran Church, Brentwood, Allegheny County, Pa. Records
did.abstract: The Zion Lutheran Church was founded in 1800 at White Hall (Surgeon's Hall), Pennsylvania and was relocated to Brentwood (Allegheny County), Pennsylvania in 1955. The collection contains seven volumes of combined church records and a scrapbook from 1863-1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Zion Lutheran Church was founded in 1800 at White Hall (Surgeon's Hall), Pennsylvania. The church was relocated to Brentwood (Allegheny County), Pennsylvania in 1955.

The collection totals seven volumes of combined church records and a scrapbook from 1863-1981. The first two volumes of church records, from 1863-1923, are in German. The church records include information regarding baptisms, confirmations, communions, marriages, burials, new members, and dismissals. The scrapbook contains photocopied histories of the church, anniversary programs, and clippings.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed with permission by the Archives of Industrial Society in 1981.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Original records are in the possession of the Zion Lutheran Church of Brentwood, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania.
